items.title: It's FOSS - World's Leading Linux & Open Source Web Portal
items.description: With It's FOSS, you'll learn the latest news from the open source world. You'll also learn to use Linux effectively with top class tutorials and expert tips.

items.title: About
items.content:
It‚Äôs FOSS is an award-winning web-portal that focuses on Open Source in general and Linux in particular.

While there are several other Linux websites on the¬†internet, It‚Äôs FOSS specifically focuses on beginners to Linux world. Its motto is to make your desktop Linux experience better. The aim of It‚Äôs FOSS is to increase the number of Linux desktop users and that aim is achieved by helping them to solve various issues one might encounter. Tutorials are written keeping beginners in mind with screenshots and proper steps.

If you wonder how come It‚Äôs FOSS is different from several other blogs in the¬†same arena, let me tell you one thing. All the tips, tricks and tutorials are tried and tested first by us. We won‚Äôt suggest you to try anything which we haven‚Äôt tried ourselves.

Apart from how-to tutorials, It‚Äôs FOSS also provides information on various applications available to make the Linux desktop experience better. News related to Open Source are also covered to keep the readers updated.

Awards for It‚Äôs FOSS

Apart from the regular appreciations by thousands of readers, It‚Äôs FOSS has been awarded:

  • Best Software Blog by IndiBlogger in 2013
  • Top 5 software blogs by Blog Adda in 2015
  • Top 10 Linux websites to follow by Make Use Of 2017

What will you learn at It‚Äôs FOSS?

  • Learn more about desktop Linux. Be a Linux guru¬†in your friend circle
  • Solving common occurring issues in Linux
  • Get to know more about desktop Linux and its usage
  • Know and discover new Linux applications and programs to use
  • Know about desktop customization and beautifying your Linux desktop
  • Learn about the latest happening in Linux and Open Source world
  • Become a better Linux user

How to get more out of It‚Äôs FOSS?

  • Visit the website regularly
  • Use the search option on the right-hand side to look for older articles on your topic of interest
  • Add our feed to your favorite feed-reader
  • Subscribe to our weekly newsletter¬†to get all the latest articles in your inbox
  • Like us on Facebook to stay updated on latest happenings
  • Join our exclusive Facebook group of Linux users
  • Join our WhatsApp or Telegram group
  • Do join our friendly community forum and seek help and advice from fellow Linux users

Media Partnership

It‚Äôs FOSS has been the official media partners for a number of international Linux and Open Source events. Some of the main ones are:

  • Open Source Summit organized by The Linux Foundation, Europe
  • FOSSBackstage, Germany
  • OSCAL, Albania
  • Univention Summit, Germany
  • SUSEConf
  • ApacheCon

If you want to partner with us for your own open source event, don‚Äôt hesitate to contact us.

Subscribe to Newsletter

items.title: Black Friday Deals
items.content:
Black Friday Deals for Linux Users and Tech Enthusiasts

This is a continually updated collection of deals and discount offers that should interest you as a Linux user.

Thanksgiving is around the corner. Happy Thanksgiving to folks in the USA.

It is also the time for Black Friday and Cyber Monday deals.

Take a look at the current deals and see if something interests you.

Do keep in mind that some deals are for a limited time only and they have been duly mentioned.

Most, if not all, services have a money-back policy. It helps in getting your money back if you don't like the product or service. Please get those details before you decide to buy.

Some of the links here are affiliate links which means we may get a commission when you purchase at no additional cost to you.

pCloud

Swiss-based cloud storage service pCloud provides a native Linux client, backup options and a lucrative lifetime purchase option (you only pay once).

Offer: Up to 80% off

The deal ends on 30th November.

Proton Mail and VPN

Swiss-based Proton is known for privacy-focused services. Their Black Friday offer is giving up to 40% off on various products.

Offer: Up to 40% off

The deal ends on 2nd December.

üëÅÔ∏è‚Äçüó®Ô∏è
Not able to see some deals? Try disabling your ad blocker.

KodeKloud

An online platform to learn all the cutting-edge DevOps technologies like Docker, Kubernetes and Hashicorp. There is playgrounds for you to do hands-on, learning paths and preparations for certification exams.

Offer: Up to 55% off

The deal ends on 27th November.

No Starch Press

A prestigious, indie tech publisher with some of the best known Linux books ever.

Offer: 35% off + FREE shipping on U.S. orders over $50 with code HOLIDEALS.

The deal ends on 28th Novemeber.

A Cloud Guru

Another portal specifically focused on teaching you cutting-edge DevOps technologies with hands-on playground labs.

Offer: Up to 50% off

The deal ends on 2nd December.

Mega

End to end encrypted cloud storage service with a native Linux client.

Offer: 2 years of 2 TB of cloud storage at 30% discount.

The deal ends on 30th November.

Datacamp

Learn the data skills you need online at your own pace‚Äîfrom non-coding essentials to data science and machine learning.

Offer: Up to 65% off

The deal ends on 8th December.

Cloud Academy

From AWS, Azure, and GCP to software development and data ‚Äì stay up to date, learn new skills, and advance your career with our modern tech platform.

Offer: Up to 35% off

The deal ends on 26th November.

Backblaze

Cloud backups for your personal files or Linux servers.

Offer: Up to 20% off with BLAZEON22 code

The deal starts 25the November and goes till 28th November

Star Labs

The UK-based Star Labs system specializes in high-end Linux powered laptops, desktops and mini PCs.

Offer: Up to 30% off on selected models

The deal ends on 28th November.

Internxt

Web3 based decentralized cloud storage service for privacy enthusiasts.

Offer: Up to 70% off

The deal ends on 5th December.

Unlocator

VPN and Smart DNS service that lets you unlock streaming services like Netflix, Hulu, Peacock, etc.

Offer: Up to 70% off with coupon code BLACK2022

The deal ends on 28th November.

Teachable

Teachable is perhaps the most popular learning management system for hosting your online courses.

Offer: Up to 35% off

The deal ends on 28th November.

SimpleLogin

Protect your email address. Send and receive emails anonymously.

Offer: $20 instead of $30 for the first year.

The deal ends on 28th November.

Cloudways

Managed cloud hosting. Deploy multiple WordPress websites on a single server and cut down your hosting costs.

Offer: $20 instead of $30 for the first year.

The deal ends on 2nd December.

Humble Bundle

Get DRM-free games for PC for free every month. Part of your purchase goes to charity.

Offer: Annual membership for $89 instead of $120 with code HOLIDAY12

The deal ends on 2nd December.

Codecademy (starts 21st Nov)

Codecademy Pro offers exclusive courses plus the chance to build portfolio-ready projects and connect with other learners.

While there are only a few courses on Linux, there are plenty on Python and other languages.

Offer: 50% off

The deal starts on 21st November and ends on 2nd December.

ONLYOFFICE

The open source MS Office alternative is offering discount on their managed cloud office solution.

Offer: Up to 50% off

The deal ends on 28th Novemeber.

Plural Sight

Develop critical tech skills. Cut cycle times. Build happier, healthier tech teams. And transform your goals into gains. All with Pluralsight.

Offer: Up to 50% off

The deal ends on 2nd December.

Inoreader

An online feed reader to follow your favorite websites, save articles and more.

Offer: 6 months free on the annual plan

The deal ends on 30th November.

Get $200 Credit on DigitalOcean Cloud Servers

DigitalOcean is a cloud server hosting platform focused on developers and self-hosters.

You can get a Linux server of various configurations or use it to deploy a Kubernetes cluster or host your own App platform. Object storage and block storage are also available.

With its marketplace, you can deploy a new Linux server pre-configured with popular open source software like WordPress, Ghost, MongoDB and many more.

  • No time limit to getting the deal
  • Only valid for new user accounts
  • The entire $200 credit is valid for 60 days
Get $200 With DigitalOcean

Get $100 Credit for Linode Servers

It's pretty much the same as DigitalOcean. After all, Linode is a direct competitor of DigitalOcean.

Linode is also a cloud server hosting platform focused on developers and self-hosters.

You can get a Linux server of various configurations or use it to deploy a Kubernetes cluster or host your own App platform. Object storage and block storage are also available.

With its 1-click deployment marketplace, you can deploy a new Linux server pre-configured with popular open source software like WordPress, Ghost, MongoDB and many more.

With Linode Stackscripts, you can deploy a new Linux server with a custom configuration of your choice.

  • No time limit to get the deal
  • Only valid for new user accounts
  • The entire $100 credit is valid for 60 days
Get $100 With Linode

More deals?

We'll be updating this page with more deals as they arrive and remove the old and expired ones.

If you know any other offers that could be of interest to Linux and DevOps users, do let us know.

items.title: Subscribe
items.content:
The FOSS Weekly Newsletter

A wholesome Linux newsletter with the latest releases, relevant news, tips and tutorials, trivia and memes, quizzes and deals for desktop Linux users.

Testimonials

‚Äú

I love reading Itsfoss.com website, but I don't always have the time to do so, so I depend on the newsletter to provide me with the a good summary of what I should be keeping up with in the Linux community. I always look forward to reading the newsletter.

Marcelo Lewin

Founder, PythonNerds.com

‚Äú

Superior format ... graphics ... easier for me to ascertain articles of interest ... thank you for redesigning

Hud Huddleston

Artist, USA

‚Äú

I have been a regular reader of both the newsletter and the web site almost since it first started. The articles are current, Unbiased, factual, and informative. With useful links for further information and research. Would recommend subscribing to any Linux user at any level.

Paul Illingworth

Former Lecturer in Computing, France/UK

‚Äú

I like the newsletter Super for lots of Privacy novelties, such as Proton VPN and secure mail client Tutanota. I also find the support and explanation about the Linux system and use of Terminal instructive. I have already helped several people set up a Linux distro on their old computer. Be sure to continue like this. Thanks for the good work.

Marc Van Hoof

69 years old retiree, Belgium

‚Äú

I find the newsletter to be clear, detailed, and comprehensive, addressing all the latest changes and updates that might interest me. I am pleased to get a Pro membership subscription, knowing that I'm supporting Abhi's efforts while gaining access to the best information available on the open-source world

Jim Sage

Retired Aerospace Engineer, USA

‚Äú

I am a linux fan and I think Linux's potentiel is much more than windows. I like to be informed about the last trends in the area without speculation and in a realistic way. The newsletter is perfect for that.

Aktemur G√∂ktuƒü

Data Engineer, Finland/Turkey

Highlights

  • üì∞

    News

    Stay updated with latest distribution and open source application releases and development.

  • üî≠

    Discover Applications

    Don't stay behind. Explore new open source applications each week. Who knows you get your next favorite tool this way.

  • üêß

    Linux Tips

    Tips and tutorials to increase your Linux knowledge and help you use your desktop Linux better and more efficiently.

  • üß©

    Puzzles and Memes

    Linux focused crosswords, memes more. You won't get these stuff on any other Linux website. How cool is that!

Latest Newsletters

FOSS Weekly #22.44: Mastodon, Tagging in KDE, Why Cinnamon, Linux Deals and More

This edition of the FOSS Weekly Newsletter is about being thankful and exploring a lesser known feature in KDE.

FOSS Weekly #22.43: Fedora 37 Released, Firewalls and More Linux Stuff

This edition of FOSS Weekly newsletter focuses on Fedora 37 release and Firewalls.

FOSS Weekly #22.42: Must Know Commands, New Apt Tool, Teams on Linux and More

This edition of FOSS Weekly Newsletter introduces a new apt tool nala along with the list of essential Linux commands.

FOSS Weekly #22.41: Zorin OS 16.2, CLI Tools, Discord Bots and More

This week's issue shares some interesting command line tools among other things.

FOSS Weekly #22.40: Vanilla OS, Impervious Browser, Vim Guides and More

This week's newsletter focuses on improving your Vim skill and introducing new open source projects.

FOSS Weekly #22.39: Ubuntu 22.10 Release Special, New Rhino Linux, Halloween Makeover, and More

Ubuntu 22.10 and Halloween are the highlight of this edition of FOSS Weekly.

Explore our plans

Free

$0 Subscribe now

Member

With premium subscription, you get
  • No advertisement
  • Early access to some premium content
  • Audio version of selected articles
  • To support It's FOSS
